#Text=Lo de Marcos
#Text=Lo de Marcos is a town in Nayarit , Mexico .
#Text=It has a year-round population of around 2,500 , which swells to 3,000-3,500 between November and April .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The tourist crowd is an interesting blend of Mexican and international visitors .
#Text=Many of the rental properties on or near the beach are owned by Mexicans from inland , most of those from Guadalajara .
#Text=Probably 60-70 % of the tourists in Lo de Marcos are retirees that are there for part or all of the winter .
#Text=Many of those are recreational vehicle owners that live in the 5 main RV parks on or near the beach .
#Text=Of the non-Mexican tourists , the split seems to be around 80%-20 % Canadians to Americans , judging by the license plates in town .
#Text=Americans are most likely to be from Northern California , Oregon , or Washington State .
#Text=Canadians are most likely to be from British Columbia , Alberta , Saskatchewan and Quebec .
#Text=One of the jokes in town is that there are about as many Saskatchewan Roughrider flags flying as there are Mexican flags .
#Text=The notable Quebecois tourist population in Lo de Marcos is primarily at the north end of the beach .
#Text=Seasonal residents sometimes refer to this jokingly as the " French Quarter " .
#Text=So yes , you can be misunderstood in at least 3 languages in this little town .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Getting to Lo de Marcos ( or anywhere on the Riviera Nayarit ) , is easy .
#Text=Direct busses up highway 200 are available from the Puerto Vallarta airport .
#Text=It 's about 45 minutes to an hour from the PV airport to Lo de Marcos .
#Text=Get around
#Text=At about 2 square kilometers , all of Lo de Marcos is very walkable , even with a beer in hand .
#Text=Visitors often travel to nearby towns such as San Francisco ( San Pancho ) , Sayulita , Rincon de Guayabitos , and La Pe単ita for additional sightseeing .
#Text=This can be done via taxi or bus .
#Text=Buses run frequently along highway 200 .
#Text=The bus stop for Lo de Marcos is near the convenience store on the highway .
#Text=See
#Text=Lo de Marcos ' biggest draw is obvious .
#Text=It is blessed with a long , wide stretch of near-perfect , and almost completely empty , beach .
#Text=There is a river outflow on the north end of the beach near the Tlaquepaque RV park and resort , and tidal pools at the south end .
#Text=Humpback whales are commonly seen off of the beach .
#Text=Lo de Marcos is built around a central natural wetland , where turtles , waterfowl , and other wildlife can be spotted .
#Text=Iguanas are not uncommon .
#Text=There are festivals several times a year , including independence day and Semana Santa ( Easter week ) .
#Text=On these holidays and long weekends , the beach swells with tourists from inland .
#Text=Do
#Text=What not to do is more like it .
#Text=Hanging out in a chair on the fantastic beach with a beer and friends should be this town 's logo .
#Text=The surf break at Lo de Marcos can range from lake calm to large angry breakers .
#Text=The south end of the beach is suitable for surfing , and it 's not uncommon for the local kids to show up with their boards after school .
#Text=Most of the surf break at Lo de Marcos are large breakers that crash quickly and produce a long , strong churn , very suitable for boogie boarding by people of all ages .
#Text=Kayaking is popular here .
#Text=Many species of fish inhabit the waters just off the coast here .
#Text=Sierra , Dorado , Huachinango ( red snapper ) , sea perch , and Bhota ( blue triggerfish ) are commonly fished for because of their abundance and excellent taste .
#Text=If you 're interested in angling or catching your lunch , many local fishermen are open to taking on passengers , and both the rate and company is always good .
#Text=Golf-
#Text=The town is blessed with a lovely little golf course 15 minutes away .
#Text=For US$ 15 a day , you can golf to your hearts content at Campo de Esuenos ( Field of Dreams ) .
#Text=This lovely executive course recently expanded to include a new par 4 and a new signature par 5 with an island green .

#Text=In addition , a new open air clubhouse with state of the art kitchen , dance floor , and Canadian satellite TV on the big screen ensure that this will be a well-used party destination for the Canadian and American snowbirds .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There are a few souvenir shops with handmade crafts .
#Text=Several stores specialize in beach gear ( towels , beach toys , inflatables , etc ) .
#Text=There are several clothing outlets .
#Text=In general , Lo de Marcos has all of the staples of day-to-day living , but does not have the overdeveloped ( and expensive ) retail of traditional travel destinations .
#Text=There are also some beach vendors selling jewelry and local handicrafts , but you certainly wo n't be harassed by them like in established tourist destinations .
#Text=If you 're looking to shop , the 15 minute drive to Rincon de Guayabitos or La Pe単ita to the north , or Sayulita or Puerto Vallarta to the south are in order .
#Text=Coco Loco Sports & Outdoors , 24 Luis Echeverria .
#Text=10:00 - 16:00 , summers .

#Text=Full range of surf and deep sea fishing gear , Coleman outdoor products , Benotto bicucles , repair parts and accessories , rental bicycles , Sierra Verde packs and can recommend licensed fishing guides in the area .
#Text=The only sporting goods store between Tepic and Puerto Vallarata .
#Text=Drink
#Text=There are 3 or 4 liquor stores in Lo de Marcos .
#Text=Liquor prices are , on average , about 10 % higher than in discount chains or outlets in larger towns .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are 4 or 5 great restaurants in Lo de Marcos , most offering excellent traditional Mexican fare .
#Text=The restaurant at the Tlaquepaque Hotel is excellent .
#Text=On Saturday nights , the number of food service outlets triples as the town square comes alive with taco wagons and entertainment .
#Text=" Taco hopping " is a common Saturday activity among seasonal visitors .
#Text=The puerco con pi単a ( roasted pork with pineapple ) and tacos lengua ( beef tongue ) are local favourites .
#Text=Ground pork is the most common taco served .
#Text=Because of the abundance of fresh seafood , excellent ceviche is abundant .
#Text=Lo de Marcos also has a fantastic rustic clay oven bakery , producing a wide variety of breads , cakes , pastries , and other delectable treats .

#Text=There are several grocery stores with all the items required for daily life , and also a local produce wagon that will bring all varieties of produce to your door , including tourist imports like potatoes and apples .
#Text=And no trip to the town square would be complete without a slice of Arcelia 's world-famous chocolate tres-leche cake .
#Text=Homesick for some western fare ?
#Text=Burgers and hot dogs abound in Lo D , but many visitors head up to Rincon de Guayabitos to someplace like Jaimie y Tequila Willie 's on the south end of the beach .
#Text=Here the Western Canadian influence is in full effect , since you can watch an NHL hockey game and chow down on very reasonably priced prime imported Alberta beef .
